Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so many things about the ancient greek olympics and the mark that they've left on the modern olympics, including things ranging on topics from doping scandals to the participation of women. I feel as though I'm able to now discuss the olympics and things such as athletes' political actions, the olympics opening ceremony, etc. by drawing on the numerous sources we read during class such as Coubertin, Miller, Pindar, and others.

By taking this course I learned about the history of the Olympic Games (from its ancient origins and the origins of the modern Games in 1896). Additionally, we explored myths from antiquity and various socioeconomically topics and issues related to the Olympics such as the role of Nationalism, feminism, racial topics and doping.
we learned the history of the Olympic Games, the movement associated with it, and various significant events that happened along the way to the modern Olympic Games.

I learned about the Olympics in modern and ancient times. We focused heavily on the surrounding culture of the Olympics like amateurism and arete. I developed my research textual analysis skills immensely.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths of the course include that the student presentations were really interesting and helpful because we were able to learn about connections between our class readings and things that weren't touched on. The presentations also sparked discussion which added to the overall discussion. The overall discussion of the class was also a strength because it really allowed us to explore what we thought of the readings and it gave us freedom to talk about that which we thought was important. The discussion posts were also a strength because we got to see what each other member of the class was thinking which was interesting and then we could ask questions during the class discussion period. In my opinion, there were no weaknesses of the class.
I enjoyed the "chronological journey" the course had as well as the student presentations each week.
Very interesting content and the seminar style class is great!
The class was structured supurbly. We always knew what was going to be discussed and were able to prepare effectively for a lively discussion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most definitely. I got to learn things about the ancient olympics that I had never known before and directly from primary sources, too. It was also very interesting to explore the history of the modern olympics and how it related to things such as civil rights and nazi-dominance, as examples. It was very interesting at all times and if you enjoy learning about sports or competition and want to be able to discuss them through a political and social lense, I recommend you take the class.
I would recommend this course to other students who are interested in learning about the Olympic Games.
YES! Super interesting and relevant content. A great seminar to take!
Absolutely, not only did I learn a lot, I thoroughly enjoyed the class as a whole.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
